Rick Perry issued a fast: tracking order in 2005 to encourage the construction of coal-fired power plants in Texas.
The fast: tracking order aimed to expedite the processing of environmental permit applications for these power plants, shortening the administrative hearings from one year to six months.
TXU Corp: an energy company, announced plans to build eight coal-fired units after Perry's order was issued, with Perry himself supporting the project at a press conference.
Bill White: the Democratic nominee for governor and Houston's mayor at the time, opposed the construction of these coal-fired power plants as a member of the Texas Cities for Clean Air Coalition.
